text: Clackmannan and Eastern Stirlingshire was a parliamentary constituency in the Clackmannan area of Central Scotland. It returned one Member of Parliament (MP) to the House of Commons of the Parliament of the United Kingdom, elected by the first past the post system. The constituency was created for the 1918 general election, and abolished for the 1983 general election, when it was replaced by the new Clackmannan constituency. ==Boundaries== Following the Representation of the People Act 1948, the seat of Clackmannan and East Stirlingshire was described in 1950 as being composed of: *The Burgh of Clackmannan *Three wards of Stirlingshire, named at the time as Eastern No. 1, Eastern No. 2, and Eastern No. 3 Boundary Commission for Scotland This would continue until the seat's abolition in 1983. ==Members of Parliament== {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan="2"|Election!!Member !Party |- |style="background-color: " | | 1918 | Ralph Glyn | Unionist |- |style="background-color: " | | 1922 | MacNeill Weir | Labour |- |style="background-color: " | | 1931 | James Wellwood Johnston | Unionist |- |style="background-color: " | | 1935 | MacNeill Weir | Labour |- |style="background-color: " | | 1939 by-election | Arthur Woodburn | Labour |- |style="background-color: " | | 1970 | Dick Douglas | Labour Co-operative |- |style="background-color: " | | Feb 1974 | George Reid | SNP |- |style="background-color: " | | 1979 | Martin O'Neill | Labour |- |colspan="2"|1983 |colspan="2"|constituency abolished: see Clackmannan |} ==Elections== ===Elections in the 1910s=== ===Elections in the 1920s=== ===Elections in the 1930s=== ===Elections in the 1940s=== ===Elections in the 1950s=== ===Elections in the 1960s=== ===Elections in the 1970s=== ==References== Category:Historic parliamentary constituencies in Scotland (Westminster) Category:United Kingdom Parliamentary constituencies established in 1918 Category:United Kingdom Parliamentary constituencies disestablished in 1983 Category:Politics of Clackmannanshire Category:Stirlingshire Category:Politics of Stirling (council area)
title: Clackmannan and Eastern Stirlingshire (UK Parliament constituency)
